B'b:
Watermark B’.b. can be distinguished by three features: the eagle has a fleur-de-lis at its center, three long claws extending from its foot, and segmented wings (of which the first two segments are equally sized). (Marked with red).

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following prints:

  • Man replying ‘Not at all’, ca. 1634, Bibliothèque Nationale de France, Paris.
  • Young man in a velvet cap, 1637, Bibliothèque Nationale de France, Paris.
  • Three heads of women, one asleep, 1637, Bibliothèque Nationale de France, Paris.
  • Three heads of women, one asleep, 1637, Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam.

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 104-5)
